Description: The hollow terracotta head of a man, broken from a figure of a paidagogos; he is bearded and largely bald, with locks of hair brought down over his ears. Summary detail at the back, apparently showing the top edge of his garment. Two-piece mould. Brown clay, probably a Nile silt. Overall white dressing; much of the face and the head is painted pink.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Ptolemaic, second or first century BC.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3562)
